data.name: GPSLatitudeRef.Help
data.value: Indicates whether the latitude is north or south latitude. The ASCII value 'N' indicates north latitude, and 'S' is south latitude.

data.name: GPSLatitude.Help
data.value: Indicates the latitude. The latitude is expressed as three RATIONAL values giving the degrees, minutes, and seconds, respectively. When degrees, minutes and seconds are expressed, the format is dd/1,mm/1,ss/1. When degrees and minutes are used and, for example, fractions of minutes are given up to two decimal places, the format is dd/1,mmmm/100,0/1.

data.name: GPSLongitudeRef.Help
data.value: Indicates whether the longitude is east or west longitude. The ASCII value 'E' indicates east longitude, and 'W' is west longitude.

data.name: GPSLongitude.Help
data.value: Indicates the longitude. The longitude is expressed as three RATIONAL values giving the degrees, minutes, and seconds, respectively. When degrees, minutes and seconds are expressed, the format is ddd/1,mm/1,ss/1. When degrees and minutes are used and, for example, fractions of minutes are given up to two decimal places, the format is ddd/1,mmmm/100,0/1.

data.name: GPSAltitude.Help
data.value: Altitude, in meters, based on the reference altitude specified by GpsAltitudeRef.

data.name: GPSTimeStamp.Help
data.value: Time as coordinated universal time (UTC). The value is expressed as three rational numbers that give the hour, minute, and second.

data.name: GpsSatellites.Help
data.value: Specifies the GPS satellites used for measurements. This tag can be used to specify the ID number, angle of elevation, azimuth, SNR, and other information about each satellite. The format is not specified. If the GPS receiver is incapable of taking measurements, the value of the tag must be set to NULL.

data.name: GpsStatus.Help
data.value: Specifies the status of the GPS receiver when the image is recorded. 'A' means measurement is in progress, and 'V' means the measurement is Interoperability.

data.name: GpsMeasureMode.Help
data.value: Specifies the GPS measurement mode. 2 specifies 2-D measurement, and 3 specifies 3-D measurement.

data.name: GpsDop.Help
data.value: GPS DOP (data degree of precision). An HDOP value is written during 2-D measurement, and a PDOP value is written during 3-D measurement.

data.name: GPSSpeedRef.Help
data.value: Specifies the unit used to express the GPS receiver speed of movement. K , M , and N represent kilometers per hour, miles per hour, and knots respectively.

data.name: GPSSpeed.Help
data.value: Speed of the GPS receiver movement.

data.name: GPSTrackRef.Help
data.value: Specifies the reference for giving the direction of GPS receiver movement. T specifies true direction, and M specifies magnetic direction.

data.name: GPSTrack.Help
data.value: Direction of GPS receiver movement. The range of values is from 0.00 to 359.99.

data.name: GPSImgDirRef.Help
data.value: Specifies the reference for the direction of the image when it is captured. T specifies true direction, and M specifies magnetic direction.

data.name: GPSImgDir.Help
data.value: Direction of the image when it was captured. The range of values is from 0.00 to 359.99.

data.name: GPSMapDatum.Help
data.value: Indicates the geodetic survey data used by the GPS receiver. If the survey data is restricted to Japan, the value of this tag is 'TOKYO' or 'WGS-84'.

data.name: GPSDestLatRef.Help
data.value: Specifies whether the latitude of the destination point is north or south latitude. N specifies north latitude, and S specifies south latitude.

data.name: GPSDestLat.Help
data.value: Latitude of the destination point. The latitude is expressed as three rational values giving the degrees, minutes, and seconds respectively. When degrees, minutes, and seconds are expressed, the format is dd/1, mm/1, ss/1. When degrees and minutes are used and, for example, fractions of minutes are given up to two decimal places, the format is dd/1, mmmm/100, 0/1.

data.name: GPSDestLongRef.Help
data.value: Specifies whether the longitude of the destination point is east or west longitude. E specifies east longitude, and W specifies west longitude.

data.name: GPSDestLong.Help
data.value: Longitude of the destination point. The longitude is expressed as three rational values giving the degrees, minutes, and seconds respectively. When degrees, minutes, and seconds are expressed, the format is ddd/1, mm/1, ss/1. When degrees and minutes are used and, for example, fractions of minutes are given up to two decimal places, the format is ddd/1, mmmm/100, 0/1.

data.name: GPSDestBearRef.Help
data.value: Specifies the reference used for giving the bearing to the destination point. T specifies true direction, and M specifies magnetic direction.

data.name: GPSDestBear.Help
data.value: Bearing to the destination point. The range of values is from 0.00 to 359.99.

data.name: GPSDestDistRef.Help
data.value: Specifies the unit used to express the distance to the destination point. 'K', 'M', and 'N' represent kilometers, miles, and knots respectively.

data.name: NewSubfileType.Help
data.value: Type of data in a subfile.

data.name: SubfileType.Help
data.value: Type of data in a subfile.

data.name: BitsPerSample.Help
data.value: Number of bits per color component.

data.name: Compression.Help
data.value: Compression scheme used for the image data.

data.name: PhotometricInterp.Help
data.value: How pixel data will be interpreted.

data.name: ThreshHolding.Help
data.value: Technique used to convert from gray pixels to black and white pixels.

data.name: CellWidth.Help
data.value: Width of the dithering or halftoning matrix.

data.name: CellHeight.Help
data.value: Height of the dithering or halftoning matrix.

data.name: FillOrder.Help
data.value: Logical order of bits in a byte.

data.name: DocumentName.Help
data.value: Null-terminated character string that specifies the name of the document from which the image was scanned.

data.name: ImageDescription.Help
data.value: Null-terminated character string that specifies the title of the image.

data.name: StripOffsets.Help
data.value: For each strip, the byte offset of that strip.

data.name: Orientation.Help
data.value: Image orientation viewed in terms of rows and columns.

data.name: SamplesPerPixel.Help
data.value: Number of color components per pixel.

data.name: StripBytesCount.Help
data.value: For each strip, the total number of bytes in that strip.

data.name: MinSampleValue.Help
data.value: For each color component, the minimum value assigned to that component.

data.name: MaxSampleValue.Help
data.value: For each color component, the maximum value assigned to that component.

data.name: XResolution.Help
data.value: Number of pixels per unit in the image width (x) direction. The unit is specified by ResolutionUnit.

data.name: YResolution.Help
data.value: Number of pixels per unit in the image height (y) direction. The unit is specified by ResolutionUnit.

data.name: PlanarConfig.Help
data.value: Whether pixel components are recorded in chunky or planar format.

data.name: PageName.Help
data.value: Null-terminated character string that specifies the name of the page from which the image was scanned.

data.name: XPosition.Help
data.value: Offset from the left side of the page to the left side of the image. The unit of measure is specified by ResolutionUnit.

data.name: YPosition.Help
data.value: Offset from the top of the page to the top of the image. The unit of measure is specified by ResolutionUnit.

data.name: FreeOffset.Help
data.value: For each string of contiguous unused bytes, the byte offset of that string.

data.name: FreeByteCounts.Help
data.value: For each string of contiguous unused bytes, the number of bytes in that string.

data.name: GrayResponseUnit.Help
data.value: Precision of the number specified by GrayResponseCurve. 1 specifies tenths, 2 specifies hundredths, 3 specifies thousandths, and so on.

data.name: GrayResponseCurve.Help
data.value: For each possible pixel value in a grayscale image, the optical density of that pixel value.

data.name: T4Option.Help
data.value: Set of flags that relate to T4 encoding.

data.name: T6Option.Help
data.value: Set of flags that relate to T6 encoding.

data.name: ResolutionUnit.Help
data.value: Unit of measure for the horizontal resolution and the vertical resolution.

data.name: PageNumber.Help
data.value: Page number of the page from which the image was scanned.

data.name: TransferFunction.Help
data.value: Tables that specify transfer functions for the image.

data.name: SoftwareUsed.Help
data.value: Null-terminated character string that specifies the name and version of the software or firmware of the device used to generate the image.

data.name: DateTime.Help
data.value: Date and time the image was created.

data.name: HostComputer.Help
data.value: Null-terminated character string that specifies the computer and/or operating system used to create the image.

data.name: Predictor.Help
data.value: Type of prediction scheme that was applied to the image data before the encoding scheme was applied.

data.name: WhitePoint.Help
data.value: Chromaticity of the white point of the image.

data.name: PrimaryChromaticities.Help
data.value: For each of the three primary colors in the image, the chromaticity of that color.

data.name: ColorMap.Help
data.value: Color palette (lookup table) for a palette-indexed image.

data.name: HalftoneHints.Help
data.value: Information used by the halftone function

data.name: TileWidth.Help
data.value: Number of pixel columns in each tile.

data.name: TileLength.Help
data.value: Number of pixel rows in each tile.

data.name: TileOffset.Help
data.value: For each tile, the byte offset of that tile.

data.name: TileByteCounts.Help
data.value: For each tile, the number of bytes in that tile.

data.name: InkSet.Help
data.value: Set of inks used in a separated image.

data.name: InkNames.Help
data.value: Sequence of concatenated, null-terminated, character strings that specify the names of the inks used in a separated image.

data.name: DotRange.Help
data.value: Color component values that correspond to a 0 percent dot and a 100 percent dot.

data.name: TargetPrinter.Help
data.value: Null-terminated character string that describes the intended printing environment.

data.name: ExtraSamples.Help
data.value: Number of extra color components. For example, one extra component might hold an alpha value.

data.name: SampleFormat.Help
data.value: For each color component, the numerical format (unsigned, signed, floating point) of that component.

data.name: SMinSampleValue.Help
data.value: For each color component, the minimum value of that component.

data.name: SMaxSampleValue.Help
data.value: For each color component, the maximum value of that component.

data.name: TransferRange.Help
data.value: Table of values that extends the range of the transfer function.

data.name: InterFormat.Help
data.value: Offset to the start of a JPEG bitstream.

data.name: InterLength.Help
data.value: Length, in bytes, of the JPEG bitstream.

data.name: LosslessPredictors.Help
data.value: For each color component, a lossless predictor-selection value for that component.

data.name: PointTransforms.Help
data.value: For each color component, a point transformation value for that component.

data.name: QTables.Help
data.value: For each color component, the offset to the quantization table for that component.

data.name: DCTables.Help
data.value: For each color component, the offset to the DC Huffman table (or lossless Huffman table) for that component.

data.name: ACTables.Help
data.value: For each color component, the offset to the AC Huffman table for that component.

data.name: YCbCrCoefficients.Help
data.value: Coefficients for transformation from RGB to YCbCr image data.

data.name: YCbCrSubsampling.Help
data.value: Sampling ratio of chrominance components in relation to the luminance component.

data.name: YCbCrPositioning.Help
data.value: Position of chrominance components in relation to the luminance component.

data.name: REFBlackWhite.Help
data.value: Reference black point value and reference white point value.

data.name: Gamma.Help
data.value: Gamma value attached to the image. The gamma value is stored as a rational number (pair of long) with a numerator of 100000. For example, a gamma value of 2.2 is stored as the pair (100000, 45455).

data.name: ICCProfileDescriptor.Help
data.value: Null-terminated character string that identifies an ICC profile.

data.name: SRGBRenderingIntent.Help
data.value: How the image should be displayed as defined by the International Color Consortium (ICC).

data.name: ImageTitle.Help
data.value: Null-terminated character string that specifies the title of the image.

data.name: ResolutionXUnit.Help
data.value: Units in which to display horizontal resolution.

data.name: ResolutionYUnit.Help
data.value: Units in which to display vertical resolution.

data.name: ResolutionXLengthUnit.Help
data.value: Units in which to display the image width.

data.name: ResolutionYLengthUnit.Help
data.value: Units in which to display the image height.

data.name: PrintFlags.Help
data.value: Sequence of one-byte Boolean values that specify printing options.

data.name: HalftoneLPI.Help
data.value: Ink's screen frequency, in lines per inch.

data.name: HalftoneScreen.Help
data.value: Boolean value that specifies whether to use the printer's default screens.

data.name: JPEGQuality.Help
data.value: Private tag used by the Adobe Photoshop format. Not for public use.

data.name: GridSize.Help
data.value: Block of information about grids and guides.

data.name: Width.Help
data.value: Width, in pixels, of the thumbnail image.

data.name: Height.Help
data.value: Height, in pixels, of the thumbnail image.

data.name: ColorDepth.Help
data.value: bits per pixel (BPP) for the thumbnail image.

data.name: Planes.Help
data.value: Number of color planes for the thumbnail image.

data.name: RawBytes.Help
data.value: Byte offset between rows of pixel data.

data.name: Size.Help
data.value: Total size, in bytes, of the thumbnail image.

data.name: CompressedSize.Help
data.value: Compressed size, in bytes, of the thumbnail image.

data.name: ColorTransferFunction.Help
data.value: Table of values that specify color transfer functions.

data.name: EquipMake.Help
data.value: Null-terminated character string that specifies the manufacturer of the equipment used to record the thumbnail image.

data.name: EquipModel.Help
data.value: Null-terminated character string that specifies the model name or model number of the equipment used to record the thumbnail image.

data.name: ResolutionX.Help
data.value: Thumbnail resolution in the width direction. The resolution unit is given in ThumbnailResolutionUnit.

data.name: ResolutionY.Help
data.value: Thumbnail resolution in the height direction. The resolution unit is given in ThumbnailResolutionUnit.

data.name: Artist.Help
data.value: Null-terminated character string that specifies the name of the person who created the thumbnail image.

data.name: Copyright.Help
data.value: Null-terminated character string that contains copyright information for the thumbnail image.

data.name: LuminanceTable.Help
data.value: Luminance table. The luminance table and the chrominance table are used to control JPEG quality. A valid luminance or chrominance table has 64 entries of type Short. If an image has either a luminance table or a chrominance table, then it must have both tables.

data.name: ChrominanceTable.Help
data.value: Chrominance table. The luminance table and the chrominance table are used to control JPEG quality. A valid luminance or chrominance table has 64 entries of type Short. If an image has either a luminance table or a chrominance table, then it must have both tables.

data.name: FrameDelay.Help
data.value: Time delay, in hundredths of a second, between two frames in an animated GIF image.

data.name: LoopCount.Help
data.value: For an animated GIF image, the number of times to display the animation. A value of 0 specifies that the animation should be displayed infinitely.

data.name: PixelPerUnitX.Help
data.value: Pixels per unit in the x direction.

data.name: PixelPerUnitY.Help
data.value: Pixels per unit in the y direction.

data.name: IFD.Help
data.value: Private tag used by GDI+. Not for public use. GDI+ uses this tag to locate Exif-specific information.

data.name: ICCProfile.Help
data.value: ICC profile embedded in the image.

data.name: ExposureProg.Help
data.value: Class of the program used by the camera to set exposure when the picture is taken.

data.name: SpectralSense.Help
data.value: Null-terminated character string that specifies the spectral sensitivity of each channel of the camera used. The string is compatible with the standard developed by the ASTM Technical Committee.

data.name: GpsIFD.Help
data.value: Offset to a block of GPS property items. Property items whose tags have the prefix Gps are stored in the GPS block. The GPS property items are defined in the EXIF specification. GDI+ uses this tag to locate GPS information, but GDI+ does not expose this tag for public use.

data.name: ISOSpeed.Help
data.value: ISO speed and ISO latitude of the camera or input device as specified in ISO 12232.

data.name: OECF.Help
data.value: Optoelectronic conversion function (OECF) specified in ISO 14524. The OECF is the relationship between the camera optical input and the image values.

data.name: Ver.Help
data.value: Version of the EXIF standard supported. Nonexistence of this field is taken to mean nonconformance to the standard. Conformance to the standard is indicated by recording 0210 as a 4-byte ASCII string. Because the type is Undefined, there is no NULL terminator.

data.name: DTOrig.Help
data.value: Date and time when the original image data was generated. For a DSC, the date and time when the picture was taken. The format is YYYY:MM:DD HH:MM:SS with time shown in 24-hour format and the date and time separated by one blank character (0x2000). The character string length is 20 bytes including the NULL terminator. When the field is empty, it is treated as unknown.

data.name: DTDigitized.Help
data.value: Date and time when the image was stored as digital data. If, for example, an image was captured by DSC and at the same time the file was recorded, then DateTimeOriginal and DateTimeDigitized will have the same contents. The format is YYYY:MM:DD HH:MM:SS with time shown in 24-hour format and the date and time separated by one blank character (0x2000). The character string length is 20 bytes including the NULL terminator. When the field is empty, it is treated as unknown.

data.name: CompConfig.Help
data.value: Information specific to compressed data. The channels of each component are arranged in order from the first component to the fourth. For uncompressed data, the data arrangement is given in the PhotometricInterp tag. However, because PhotometricInterp can only express the order of Y, Cb, and Cr, this tag is provided for cases when compressed data uses components other than Y, Cb, and Cr and to support other sequences.

data.name: CompBPP.Help
data.value: Information specific to compressed data. The compression mode used for a compressed image is indicated in unit BPP.

data.name: ShutterSpeed.Help
data.value: Shutter speed. The unit is the Additive System of Photographic Exposure (APEX) value.

data.name: Aperture.Help
data.value: Lens aperture. The unit is the Additive System of Photographic Exposure (APEX) value.

data.name: Brightness.Help
data.value: Brightness value. The unit is the Additive System of Photographic Exposure (APEX) value. Ordinarily it is given in the range of -99.99 to 99.99.

data.name: ExposureBias.Help
data.value: Exposure bias. The unit is the Additive System of Photographic Exposure (APEX) value. Ordinarily it is given in the range -99.99 to 99.99.

data.name: MaxAperture.Help
data.value: Smallest F number of the lens. The unit is the Additive System of Photographic Exposure (APEX) value. Ordinarily it is given in the range of 00.00 to 99.99, but it is not limited to this range.

data.name: SubjectDist.Help
data.value: Distance to the subject, measured in meters.

data.name: Flash.Help
data.value: Flash status. This tag is recorded when an image is taken using a strobe light (flash). Bit 0 indicates the flash firing status, and bits 1 and 2 indicate the flash return status.

data.name: FocalLength.Help
data.value: Actual focal length, in millimeters, of the lens. Conversion is not made to the focal length of a 35 millimeter film camera.

data.name: MakerNote.Help
data.value: Note tag. A tag used by manufacturers of EXIF writers to record information. The contents are up to the manufacturer and are often encrypted. Because of the extremely large size of this field (over 30,000 hexidecimal pairs for some cameras), it will not be displayed in the grid.

data.name: UserComment.Help
data.value: Comment tag. A tag used by EXIF users to write keywords or comments about the image besides those in ImageDescription and without the character-code limitations of the ImageDescription tag.

data.name: DTSubsec.Help
data.value: Null-terminated character string that specifies a fraction of a second for the DateTime tag.

data.name: DTOrigSS.Help
data.value: Null-terminated character string that specifies a fraction of a second for the ExifDTOrig tag.

data.name: DTDigSS.Help
data.value: Null-terminated character string that specifies a fraction of a second for the ExifDTDigitized tag.

data.name: FPXVer.Help
data.value: FlashPix format version supported by an FPXR file. If the FPXR function supports FlashPix format version 1.0, this is indicated similarly to ExifVer by recording 0100 as a 4-byte ASCII string. Because the type is Undefined, there is no NULL terminator.

data.name: ColorSpace.Help
data.value: Color space specifier. Normally sRGB (=1) is used to define the color space based on the PC monitor conditions and environment. If a color space other than sRGB is used, Uncalibrated (=0xFFFF) is set. Image data recorded as Uncalibrated can be treated as sRGB when it is converted to FlashPix.

data.name: PixXDim.Help
data.value: Information specific to compressed data. When a compressed file is recorded, the valid width of the meaningful image must be recorded in this tag, whether or not there is padding data or a restart marker. This tag should not exist in an uncompressed file.

data.name: PixYDim.Help
data.value: Information specific to compressed data. When a compressed file is recorded, the valid height of the meaningful image must be recorded in this tag whether or not there is padding data or a restart marker. This tag should not exist in an uncompressed file. Because data padding is unnecessary in the vertical direction, the number of lines recorded in this valid image height tag will be the same as that recorded in the SOF.

data.name: RelatedWav.Help
data.value: The name of an audio file related to the image data. The only relational information recorded is the EXIF audio file name and extension (an ASCII string that consists of 8 characters plus a period (.), plus 3 characters). The path is not recorded. When you use this tag, audio files must be recorded in conformance with the EXIF audio format. Writers can also store audio data within APP2 as FlashPix extension stream data.

data.name: Interop.Help
data.value: Offset to a block of property items that contain interoperability information.

data.name: FlashEnergy.Help
data.value: Strobe energy, in Beam Candle Power Seconds (BCPS), at the time the image was captured.

data.name: SpatialFR.Help
data.value: Camera or input device spatial frequency table and SFR values in the image width, image height, and diagonal direction, as specified in ISO 12233.

data.name: FocalXRes.Help
data.value: Number of pixels in the image width (x) direction per unit on the camera focal plane. The unit is specified in ExifFocalResUnit.

data.name: FocalYRes.Help
data.value: Number of pixels in the image height (y) direction per unit on the camera focal plane. The unit is specified in ExifFocalResUnit.

data.name: LocalResUnit.Help
data.value: Unit of measure for ExifFocalXRes and ExifFocalYRes.

data.name: SubjectLoc.Help
data.value: Location of the main subject in the scene. The value of this tag represents the pixel at the center of the main subject relative to the left edge. The first value indicates the column number, and the second value indicates the row number.

data.name: ExposureIndex.Help
data.value: Exposure index selected on the camera or input device at the time the image was captured.

data.name: SensingMethod.Help
data.value: Image sensor type on the camera or input device.

data.name: FileSource.Help
data.value: The image source. If a DSC recorded the image, the value of this tag is 3.

data.name: SceneType.Help
data.value: The type of scene. If a DSC recorded the image, the value of this tag must be set to 1, indicating that the image was directly photographed.

data.name: CfaPattern.Help
data.value: The color filter array (CFA) geometric pattern of the image sensor when a one-chip color area sensor is used. It does not apply to all sensing methods.

data.name: FocalResUnit.Help
data.value: Unit of measure for ExifFocalXRes and ExifFocalYRes.
